reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is like many Premier Inns and is very modern and comfortable. The reception staff were very helpful and welcoming and the room was comfortable and clean. The size of the bath, and the fact there was a bath, was a bonus.
reviews.title: Very welcoming

reviews.text: Even though it's on a main road it was very quiet. It wasn't the cheapest Premier Inn I have stayed in but it is Inverness and it was summer.
reviews.title: Everything you would expect from a Premier Inn...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely warm Highland welcome greeted me at check in. Very friendly, very efficient.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: A nice spacious room, with the Premier Inn trademark comfy bed and crisp white bed linen all made for a very restful nights sleep after a soak in a lovely deep bath. Toiletries (hand wash and hair and body wash)are provided. Also a very good hair dryer!
reviews.title: Looking for Nessy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spotlessly clean, my only small gripe with any Premier Inn, is you can't open the windows, in case someone feels the need to smoke - or launch themselves out of one, I suppose.....
reviews.title: Exactly hat it says on the tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed overnight while travelling round Scotland. The reception and housekeeping staff were fantastic, really helpful and friendly. We ate in the attached restaurant which was really busy. The bar and waiting staff were also charming and helpful, it was a pleasure to stay there and we will return. Good location, we went on a boat trip around Loch Ness, the boat was moored just over the road from the hotel so we could leave the car and walk
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, nice hotel

reviews.text: We stay at Premier Inns whenever possible, the standard is always very good. This one is top-class. We stayed for three nights with our eight year old granddaughter. The room on the second floor, which overlooked the golf course, was very large, spotlessly clean and well furnished. The air-conditioning was a godsend overnight when it was very warm and sleep did not come easily. The staff are just wonderful, always polite, courteous and very helpful - nothing was too much trouble. The very good continental breakfast provided a perfect way to start the day, and with our granddaughter eating free very reasonably priced!
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: This hotel opened about eighteen months ago and is built on the site of what was quite a select hotel, gladly, they have kept the original frontage. There is a large car park.
reviews.title: One of the best ones

reviews.text: The Beefeater Restaurant (attached) offers very good affordable meals which are served in a pleasant environment by excellent staff who work very hard.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: This is, arguably the best of the Premier Inn estate.
reviews.title: Excellent except for wi-fi

reviews.text: This Premier Inn is in a very quiet part of inverness but very easy to get back into the city centre, the premier breakfast was very good and very good value :-). The Meals In the beefeater grill were very good (recommend the chicken burger and rocky road sundae!) The Room was spacious and clean, the double bed was comfy and the singles where also comfy. Stayed on the 3rd floor and was very quiet, a bit of workout to get up the stairs but there was a lift (just didn't use it). The Reception staff where exceptionally friendly. The Car Park can get full at night though.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Have stayed here a couple of times to break up a journey. Great location just outside town near the canal. Rooms are clean, plenty space. Was very hot one night and couldn't set air con any lower but reception gave us a floor standing fan. Restaurant very busy at night, food was fine. Breakfast was good. Will stay again.
reviews.title: Great stopover

reviews.text: Nice hotel in a quiet area, 2 minute walk to bus stop for bus into city centre, nice restaurant joined on. Clean Rooms, good service and cheap at £29, plenty of complimentary parking for restaurant and hotel. Will stay again soon!
reviews.title: Nice Quiet Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here to attend a wedding at the Loch Ness country house hotel down the road, for two nights. Great facilities- good car parking, spacious rooms, good restaurant. Friendly staff, large clean rooms and amazing breakfast. Big thumbs up all round.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We haven't stayed in a Premier Inn for a while and were very pleasantly surprised by this one - they have obviously got their act together! The rooms were fine and our evening meal at the attached Beefeater Restaurant was perfectly acceptable. Breakfast next morning - there was a choice between cooked or continental - was also fine.
reviews.title: Good Overnight Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New or newly refurbished, this was an excellent three night stay, with the added advantage of an attached Beefeater restaurant. We had a spacious room which was extremely quiet and very clean and comfortable. The hotel is across the road from cruises on the Caledonian canal and Loch Ness and within a half hours walk of Inverness centre, via the islands alongside the river. Visit the Floral Hall a few minutes away for a lovely garden and superb cafe. Not the cheapest but definitely value for money.
reviews.title: Comfortable and good value for money

reviews.text: This hotel is in lovely location and facilities are good with lovely restaurant and lounge area which was a nice surprise. Staff were all very helpful and friendly. We will definitely be back to stay !
reviews.title: Very pleasant surprise

reviews.text: They have limited their WIFI to 30 min since my last stay, will look for another hotel on the strength of this, no decaf in rooms, staff are good food is the normal Prem food, I have to book last minute so my bill is never under £100.00 and I don't think I get value for money at this price.
reviews.title: Prem time

reviews.text: I always stay in premier Inn when possible as they cater for the business class very well, have a good range for breakfast and can cater for early birds. Never had any problems before. However my last stay was disappointing as they gave us a disabled room when we booked without letting us know? If they did not have another room they should have been honest and said this at the time of booking. The washbasin was nearly at knee level, the bed was almost on the floor, the room stank of disinfectant and wee? The shower was poor and of course no bath! We felt cheated, complained but got nowhere! If you ever book here, stay away from room 2 unless your disabled or desperate.
reviews.title: Poor on this occasion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just outside Inverness, on the road to Loch Ness, this is a very good value Premier Inn. The staff on the reception desk were all very friendly and helpful. Their local knowledge was welcome and they gave us good advice about where to visit and when. The attached Beefeater restaurant was also good value, and the food a notch above the usual chain fare. It is a quiet location and there's a nice walk along the Caledonian canal next door to the hotel.
reviews.title: A friendly place to stay
